page.title: 02Village Now
page.content:
Marden and its environs have a population of approximately 2000 people. The major part of the populace lives in the village itself and the rest live in scattered dwellings and hamlets. Once the hub of the local farming community, Marden is now mainly a dormitory area for commuters to urban areas like Hereford, Leominster and Worcester.
The region is still dominated by the agricultral industry but the increase in mechanisation has meant a less labour intensive organisation and had a corresponding effect on the village ethos. Many new residences have been built in a central position and while there seems to be a good balance between the old and the new, the village has lost much of its rusticity.
